reason: Move to the orange first, as it is close to the target apple and may block the grasping path if not cleared.
Lower the arm to the working height to prepare for pulling the orange away from the target.
Pull the orange toward the robot base to move it away from the target apple area.
Continue pulling the orange to ensure sufficient clearance for grasping the apple.
Lift the arm to a safe height after clearing the orange, preparing to approach the target for grasping.
The orange has been cleared from near the target. Attempt to grasp the apple now.
Lift the arm to check if the apple was successfully grasped.
The previous grasp may not have been fully successful. Reset the hand to try again with a fresh configuration.
Retry grasping the target apple after resetting the hand posture.
Lift the arm to verify the grasp success after the second attempt.
The grasp still seems unsuccessful. Reset the hand again to prepare for another attempt.
Make another grasp attempt on the target apple with refreshed hand configuration.
Lift the arm to confirm the apple has been successfully picked up.
The target (apple) has been successfully grasped. The task is complete.
